title: Terrible Service
text: I have used Airbnb for a long time and have always had a good experience. The diversity of listings is always enjoyable and it’s always fun to see how the place looks in real life. Recently I booked an Airbnb for a trip to Mexico City. However, when I arrived the surrounding streets were filled with homeless drug addicts. As me and my girlfriend checked in were harassed our entire time trying to get into the apartment. We live in a big city so we are pretty used to getting harassed by homeless people, but this was pretty different. They kept grabbing our arms and not letting us get into our Airbnb. Neither me or my girlfriend felt safe spending the night there. So we booked a different hotel the same day and left. When I told Airbnb about my safety concerns they were not supportive at all. They said it was not their problem and they would only return less than 15% of cost despite me never spending a single night there. I would be expect this company to hold the safety of their customers in higher regard. But apparently they don’t care.

title: Grateful
text:
We are so thankful for the Airbnb staff and responsiveness after our reservation was canceled by the host.  

Airbnb staff helped us to reserve a bigger and more spacious beach home. They even applied a substantial discount. 

Thank you!

title: Password reset link is broken
text: Password reset link does not work

title: They steal
text: I believe this is the most stupid App if you want to rent one place they show you fake pictures and then when you pay the money and you go to the place if you not like the place you lose everything, because this is happened with me I don’t spend minutes in the place I leave right away but the owner get my money and App said is nothing that they can do if the owner no want to give the money back, this is crazy. They steal my money and I know this is happened with multiple people for the reason I will be to give 0 star I believe the App needs to hold the money and if you not like the place they need to refund your money because they know not everyone is honest renting a place.

title: Joke of a reservation app
text: Hosts can increase their price at will. They WON’T honor their advertised price if they don’t want to and they have up to 24 hours to keep you waiting for their answer! Many other apps out there. AVOID this SCAM!

title: Airbnb cancelled me 2 days before my trip!
text: I received an email a few days before my trip. It was from Airbnb and stated i had 24 hours to complete a verification step or my account would be suspended. I had already booked and paid for my upcoming stay. I didn’t see the email because I don’t check my personal email every day and since I didn’t verify my ID, they cancelled my reservation and suspended my account. It’s Friday and I was supposed to arrive Sunday and this is a business trip whereas I needed to find a home that was pet friendly. This makes no sense since they already processed payment and I have successfully rented via Airbnb in the past. So, if you want to ensure you’re booking is safe, I would suggest a different provider.

title: Unhelpful costumer support
text: Their, insurance policy it’s misleading and their costumer service it’s the worst I’ve ever experienced, I went through at least 10-15 representatives to have nothing resolved, if you are getting the insurance policy, read as throughly as possible, and screenshot everything, because now I can’t persist a claim with my bank for not having enough proofs and what I did read in their insurance policy back then and what it shows now it’s slightly different, favoring them, very fishy and unethical if you asks me, also do some research on their “ insurance “beforehand and get some contact information online. the numbers or emails that Airbnb will provide you are completely useless.

title: Disappointing
text: The cost for what you are getting is actually insane. People renting a camper and want more than the cost of a hotel. For a camper…. Many will charge $150+ a night and offer no tv or any amenities and still expect you to clean every inch of the place before leaving. Back to booking hotels considering this is a joke

title: Airbnb supports innocent murder
text: I have really benefited from airbnb- I’ve planned all my anniversary vacations through here. But with the nonstop slaughter of children and innocent civilians in Gaza, I’m offended that airbnb will do nothing to support these victims. Please, stand up for peace so i can plan my 2024 anniversary trip through you again.

title: Horrible customer service.
text: I had an issue with booking, so I contacted customer center to get some help. they resolved nothing and they didn’t even finish the conversation and just stop responding to me during the session. It was the worst customer experience I had. I will remove my Airbnb account after this trip and not going to use their service, ever.

title: Is it legal for airbnb to not refund tax???
text:
Airbnb used to be this place where hosts cared. Now I’m showing up to places that looks nice in photos but filthy inside. These listings are not priced right anymore with outrageous fees.

That aside, hosts are typically reasonable to work with when they’re in the wrong. What surprises me is that when hosts agree to give a refund, or cancel the booking, Airbnb refuse to refund the service fee AND the sales tax. What in the world??? At any store in the United States, or any travel services, when canceling booking, tax and fees are always refunded automatically. I’m not sure if it is even legal for airbnb to keep the sales tax when the sales the cancelled???

This company is far away from the chicken soup story it was founded on. Rest in peace. I’m going back to stay at hotels so I don’t need to deal with airbnb support.

title: Pocket Gougers
text: How do people use this app when it charges up the butt for everything. You’re telling me a $200 night turns into $550 with all the fees? How outrageous. I tried booking two nights and it was $200 a night and I thought it was $400 total until checkout. With the $200 cleaning fee, $90 airbnb service fee?!?!? And $53 in taxes?!? Total ended up being $780 for two nights like what a load of. Such POCKET PINCHERS. Worst app I ever used.

title: Best App for Home Booking
text: If you’re looking to have the most robust list of homes available for rent in any city you’re visiting in the world, Airbnb will have the most vast catalog and the most seamless app experience among the competition.

title: Glad I don’t have to pay in full with reservation
text: I

title: Terrible business
text: Airbnb has really gone down hill over the years. Terrible business that is never worth it to use, even if you think you find a good deal/ stay, don’t. Terrible customer service. Airbnb really needs to do more to hold hosts accountable and remove hosts that don’t demonstrate integrity on the platform.

title: Great place recommend if your in Salinas area
text: Close to many activities

title: Terrible customer support
text: Good luck to anyone who has their reservations cancelled due to changes in zoning laws. Support is nonexistent in finding any kind of solution and reps refuse to explain when the company knew of the changes. These laws are becoming more common and all Airbnb is doing is waiting until the last minute and canceling. As a longtime customer I won’t be back.

title: App is great, but company doesn’t protect you
text:
I recently stayed at an Airbnb that didn’t match the listing. It wasn’t a minor thing. The listing had pictures of a completely remodeled unit including removing a couple of walls to make it more open and new appliances, cabinets, and counters in the kitchen. 

I opened a dispute with Airbnb and their first response was that the unit was the same in the listing. I had to call to reopen the case and sent them pictures. They then acknowledged that the listing didn’t match what I received, but said the host still didn’t want to issue any refund.  Airbnb doesn’t protect you against bad hosts that flat out lie in their listings.

title: Favors hosts, screws over guests
text:
Insurance never seems to apply to guests.  Hosts can refuse entry or have weird requirements that are enforced after you pay, and Airbnb will give refund discretion to the host.  A host can have a “no shoes” policy and when the hosts dog tears up the shoes you left at the door. They can give any excuse and not have to reimburse through Airbnb and Airbnb insurance will tell you to go f yourself.  Also, if you are neurodivergent, or have impulse issues, you can make a mistake booking, and get refused a refund even if you want one instantly after booking, there is no refund window, even though it’s extremely unlikely anyone else would have booked and there would have been no lost opportunity cost for the host.  

Customer support lied to me to waste my time.  They said they would call me to resolve a refund request where the host didn’t give access.  They had no intention of a refund.  So after a lengthy authentication, I figured out they were just interested in wasting my time.  I wrote this to remind myself not to forget how trash Airbnb is.

title: Airbnb
text: I’m excited to use Airbnb’s services again. It’s top quality.

title: Booking was not soo great
text: Tried to login system was weird due to double profile I had.

title: App is good but Airbnb is not
text: Ever since I moved to the west coast, I stopped using Airbnb because of the very high cleaning fees and fake reviews on the listings. My honest review was removed by Airbnb.

title: Pray you never have an issue with your stay
text:
I’ve had 25 excellent stays with Airbnb. My 26th stay had an inaccurate listing. The customer service was atrocious. After being handed off to another person 3 times, they 4th person told me I’d get a refund and quoted the amount. The 5th person proceeded to tell me I actually will not be getting said refund. 
VRBO and hotels for me from now on.

title: Get a hotel
text: A $73 cleaning fee for a $76 room. No option for them to give you the “total” without clicking on every single listing and going to the reserve page. Truly, getting a hotel is now cheaper and easier.

title: Nothing but stress
text: The app is a good idea, but the support from Airbnb’s team is one of the most atrocious experiences on Earth. I’ve had an open support case for over a month, and I’d say it’s easier to pull your own teeth than it is to get any help from Airbnb. Will not be using this service moving forward, please note that they can charge your card at any time without your approval. Even if you’re not at fault. 0/10 avoid at all costs

title: I liked the app waaaay better before the default was to look for a trailer.
text: Great if you’re looking for a yurt or a camper or something bizarre but almost impossible to find a regular place due to the preset categories for the search as there isn’t one for just a regular place to stay. Super frustrating and I have already quit searching twice for an upcoming trip and will probably just bite the bullet and book a hotel.

title: Disgusting: Airbnb doesn’t protect customers
text: Well, the host didn’t tell us that they were modifying the apartment, and the paint smell made my family sick. We are coughing so hard, suffering from chest pain, and wearing masks. Airbnb said it’s not their responsibility and that we must follow whatever the host says. The host refuses refunds. I hope someone can read this and see how terrible they ignore their customers’ well-being and honestly, do they even know that paint smell causes cancer?

title: Horrific company
text: The business pits hosts and guests against each other trying to maintain a five star status on each side.  The company doesn’t truly support guests or hosts well.  As with so many companies, it’s just about keeping their fees in their pockets.

title: Martinique hosts are sketchy, support very slow…
text: While in Martinique in late 2023 I had several issues with non-responsive hosts, which must be poorly vetted by AirBnb. Online support from them was very slow, thus leaving me on my own to deal with each and every issue.

title: My nice stays
text: In the past years since 2019 I had a amazing time on in 2023 spring it was nice and close to Disney and sea world and amazing time in 2021 in Myrtle beach and in 2019 Myrtle all my years have been amazing I will go in 2024 Again

title: Notifications
text:
There is this issue with notifications on iPhone. If I communicate with a host or anyone, ever after I have read the message, the notification bubble
Never goes away. I searched forums for this and only recommendation (besides saying good byte to abb) was delete the app and reinstall. I mean, that most ridiculous thing. 

How can this be fixed? How will one know if there is really a new notification. I have logged in from website to read message hoping new indicator goes away. I work in IT and I know it is sooooo easy to fix. Please fix this issue before many move to other platforms just out of annoyance. Easy lift team!!!

title: Cannot login to iPad app
text: I’ve been trying to log into the app from my iPad and the app rejects the code that’s sent for verification. It rejected the code so many times I’m now locked out of my account. No customer service available for this issue either. Please fix.

title: Negative reviews are removed
text: I no longer trust this company. Twice recently when I left negative reviews (which in no way violated their policy), the owner was able to have the review removed. Given this, how can anyone trust that a property is as good as the reviews would have you believe?

title: App or customer service doesn’t let you book on holidays
text: What’s the point of this his app

title: Fees
text: It’s way more expensive than few years back. Not worth anymore

title: Accused me of trying to book a place for a party.
text: After booking several trips on Airbnb, having several 5 star reviews, and never breaking any airbnb rules they blocked my account from booking Private Homes. FOR NO REASON! They said I was “going to throw a party” in the home and then after reviewing my complaint they doubled down and refused to let me book anything again. I have never thrown a party in an airbnb, broken anything, broke the rules… literally did this for no reason and ruined my whole weekend. Better off just getting a hotel anyways with all the extra cleaning stuff they make you do while you’re PAYING to stay there and PAYING for a cleaning fee. They literally discriminated against me because of my age (22). This is unbelievable and I will NEVER book with them again.

title: Don’t want sue but hey if it’s comes down to it
text:
Want to start this off by saying I used airbnb before and I’m aware of the policies and never had an issue with them until this week.

I had the worst airbnb experience ever

The host was constantly lying to us and support was literally no help at all. All they did was ended my case tried communicating from the phone and with support. Told them that the guest didn’t even stay there for more than 10 hours and was forced to leave the airbnb. Even showed them evidence that the host alter the listing after we contacted support. And we requested to end the trip early and didn’t cared if we were charged the night cause we did stay there for the night (10 hours total ). They said they would take care of it and nope nothing has happen. Try contacting them again and go through the process and boom “case close” “case close”. So if i’m not refunded for the time that I didn’t stay there then I guys I’ll be seeing you guys in court. I just want my refund that’s it so I can move on with my life.

title: Airbnb Host
text: I wanted to say I have been hosting 7 years. Airbnb has strict rules for hosts. I don’t agree with the review system so much but if people are honest with their reviews and list actual issues then it give the next person an honest view of what to expect. I get good renters and I respond quickly to any questions. Other vacation rental management places take 35% and they don’t care like the owner does. I think the app is easy to use except the notes tab being changed.  Don’t let someone’s bad experience scare you off. Most are great!

title: They are out to get you
text: Hosts hide fees in hidden section on their page, if you don’t know where to look then you can and will end up getting fined hundreds in random fees. I booked a place that was listed as a house with a hot tub, as soon as I book it, the host messaged me about paying $20 a day to use the hot tub, and when I complained to Airbnb they backed the host. There were hundreds of dollars worth of hidden fees buried in this hosts rules section (which is behind 4 menus to find). I will never use this app again, with friends and family having issues with AirBnB, I knew I was pushing my luck but they’ve finally gotten me to delete the app and never turn back. Hotels are great and never stopped being great

title: Scammy at best
text: I save more money staying in a hotel. What am I paying a $150-300 cleaning fee for when majority of hosts are giving me a list of chores to complete??? Asking me to pile the towels in one spot is one thing, but giving me multiple steps before I check out is an issue. “Throw a load of any used towels into the washer, take out trash and recycling, strip beds and pile sheets into washing room, load dirty dishes into dish washer, etc. etc.” I paid an extra $250 to CLEAN??? It should be one or the other. You know what I need to do at a hotel before check-out? *check out*. “$40/night turns into $240 really quick. I might as well stay that night in a luxury hotel. Absolutely aggravating.

title: Atrocious
text: Contacted the “safety team” at 1:30am bc my booking suddenly fell through. Walked around the streets and finally found a place to stay. They answered at 4am and immediately closed the chat bc I did not respond within 10 minutes.  Unprofessional, rude, unhelpful.  Won’t use again.

title: Misleading/deceptive pricing
text:
Airbnb advertises prices that end up nearly quadrupling when you check out. First, the price doubles when you select a date (sometimes triples if you select a weekend date); then that price doubles again after cleaning fees, service fees, and taxes.

How hard is it to just show a realistic nightly price inclusive of fees and taxes? The cleaning fees, service fees, and taxes are part of an existing algorithm, so at the very least, the minimum fees should be included in pricing.

My latest of many examples is a place advertised at $137/night. At checkout it increased to $494/night.

title: Easy
text: Easy to book. Thanks

title: Prices are wrong
text: I am not saying the prices are misleading: they are wrong, because they do not factor in a varying number of fees. That makes this app unusable for me.

title: Worst experience ever
text: I had Airbnb for a while and never ever booked a single room I decided I wanted to go to Cleveland the weekend before New Year’s to see and celebrate my girlfriends birthday and they band me from booking because I’m more likely to throw a party and now I’m stuck in Cleveland 4 hours away from home with no place to sleep

title: You can’t select text
text: Most things about this app are good. But I went to select the name of a park near an place I was looking at staying to copy and paste it into google and wasn’t able to. Why is this  feature that would be removed? I am dyslexic which makes spelling, remembering, and typing words difficult. Please just let me copy and paste things.

title: Terrible customer service
text: My account experienced a glitch and it was impossible to reach a human in customer service to help me.

title: Denied booking for no reason
text: I have booked countless Airbnb’s, spent thousands of dollars on this app. I have perfect reviews from every single host that has reviewed me. I have had absolutely zero issues with Airbnb before. Tried to book a space for me and a couple friends on New Year’s Eve, I was denied based on “potential unauthorized parties” I reached out to the host, support, everything I could only to be left with no explanation. I have never had a party in an Airbnb, I have never even held a party in my own home. This one computer error has ruined our New Years plans. 2 of my other friends also tried to book the same spot and were given the same error. This is CLEARLY an error on AIRBNBs behalf. This needs to be fixed. This has left an extremely bad taste in my mouth concluding what has been 4+ years of perfect experiences with this app. All 3 parties involved loose here, including Airbnb.

title: AirCover is a joke
text: Their AirCover agents are empowered monkeys who make arbitrary decisions without no standard process. They violate their own internal rules by their absurd process to submit a claim. They never pay back hosts who are paying thousands of dollars every year/month for insurance

title: Use other options like Vacasa or Vrbo
text:
The company does everything to protect the hosts but nothing to protect the paying customers. There’s zero oversight for the hosts, they can post deceptive pictures of their place that shows a completely different place or only the “clean or fixed” parts. This has happened to us 2 out of the last 3 rentals.

The most recent one was the last straw. We booked a long term stay and paid $1800 upfront. The apartment looked decent for its affordability but when we went there it was not clean dirt everywhere, the carpets were disgusting, the paint was peeling, shower was broke, etc. It was not a clean and safe place for our twin toddlers. On the 2nd day we asked the host if we can cancel and get the money back if we paid for 5 nights, he said ok. We got another place on Vrbo expecting we would get refunded. 

We did not, even after a long battle with Airbnb and the host, Airbnb has never refunded our money. This is money that could have been used for our girls’ college fund or other things for our family. Airbnb and the host basically stole our money. Don’t ever use this app, we started using other alternatives and have had much better success. Until they provide more accountability toward the hosts…STAY FAR FAR AWAY!!
